alert.note: Alert for Chase; Greenwood; Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 10:31AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ... HEAVY RAIN WITH EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS ... At 1025 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms with very heavy rain in western Chase County moving to the east at 25 mph. This cluster of rain and thunderstorms is expected to move into Eastern Chase and Northern Greenwood county in the next 30 minutes. HAZARD...Very heavy rain with winds up to 25 to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rain will cause ponding on roadways and low visibility conditions. Individuals outside on bicycles will have difficulty navigating roadways, especially gravel roads in the heaviest rain. Ponding on roads and muddy conditions on gravel road will become likely. Locations impacted include... Marion, Peabody, Cottonwood Falls, Madison, Strong City, Florence, Hamilton, Burns, Bazaar, Virgil, Elmdale, Matfield Green, Cedar Point, Eureka City Lake, Hymer, Thrall, Wonsevu, Tallgrass Prairie, Saffordville and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 97 and 115. Motorists should use caution on roadways and ponding water will create an increased risk of hydroplaning. Reduce speed to help mitigate this risk.
